etymology.description: 臤(臤) (xián, "strong") is an ancient form of 賢(賢) (xián, "worthy")
etymology.interpretation: The character 臤(臤) represents an earlier version of 賢(賢) (xián, "worthy") and reflects historical orthographic variations before the standardization of Chinese characters.

examples.chinese: 他的臤力不可抵挡(他的臤力不可抵擋)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de xián lì bù kě dǐdǎng.

examples.chinese: 运动员体格臤壮(運動員體格臤壯)，精神焕发(精神煥發)。
examples.pinyin: Yùndòngyuán tǐgé xián zhuàng, jīngshén huànfā.
examples.english: The athlete has a robust physique and his spirit is invigorated.
